title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen regarding expectations, floor preferences, etc, then an in person interview with manager(s) of floors you’re interested in. They also offer shadowing on the floor. Very straightforward, good experience overall.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Hostess Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pitts, PA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Simple, convenient, smooth and fast process! Received a call from a recruiter and was offered a position the next day! Worked well with me allowing for notice at my current position. I feel this is a great match!
Interview Questions: Understanding of the role Ability to preform the role Work schedule Income and benefits Required uniform

title: HIM Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview done virtually with typical interview questions. Very kind staff, easy to talk to. Explained interview, hiring, benefits and compensation adequately. Interviewing staff was very knowledgeable. I would highly recommend.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this position?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions. Seems that answering in the star format is what they’re looking for. Small focus on their core values and problem-solving diversity and inclusion. Asked about insurance registration knowledge and previous epic usage.
Interview Questions: How do you handle yourself in stressful situations?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview. Layed back interviewers and everyone seemed very friendly. Questions were straightforward and not difficult to understand. I was asked to shadow afterwords and got to see what the unit was really like!
Interview Questions: Name a situation where you had to deal with a difficult situation and how did you handle it

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions:
first you interview on phone
then you interview on site
after that shadowing opportunity 
then offer comes over phone or email 

after that you can either accept their offer or try to negotiate the pay then can accept the job or turn it down
Interview Questions:
what are you weaknesses 
what type of patients have you worked with before

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Great interview. Positive experience. Great feedback. Very communicative to the process.  Done over Zoom. Was able to shadow the unit. Very enjoyable and easy smooth process. Low stress and pressure
Interview Questions: Describe a way you provide patient care

title: Associate Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is pretty streamlined. First round with your future team members and architect. Second round with managers. Third and final round with director. It is pretty time consuming though.
Interview Questions: SQL basic questions. The interviewer is primarily looking for identifying your attention to detail and problem solving skills than syntax.

title: Physician Assistant, PA-C Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I applied on indeed. Then I received a phone screen. After that, I was invited to the office for another interview onsite. It was about a week delay until I heard back about the job.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this practice?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Thorough and insightful. They do drug testing and also check your blood levels to be sure you’re up on vaccinations and don’t need boosters. Didn’t end up being a good fit for my schedule but thought they did a good job
Interview Questions: Tell me about your biggest challenge

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Typical but before I went in they already inquired about me from other employers from friends that they knew that worked in the same facility. It was a bit odd.
Interview Questions: Why I changed careers at this point.

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: They gave me a tour where I met many of the personnel working there then we proceeded to a conference room to discuss my resume, the job description, and answered a few behavioral/situational questions. The process was laid back and I felt very comfortable.
Interview Questions: Behavioral and situational questions, asked about dignity of patients which I appreciated.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was great, then transitioned to a face to face interview with the second interview. Questions were broad and they were very nice. You might even have a second interview over the phone, depends on location.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for AHN?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Very quick, phone interview with HR. Then met with the unit manager. Got a tour of the unit after answering questions. Also got to meet some employees! HR interview was more of getting more information than an interview!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nursing assistant?

title: Registered Nurse, Telemetry Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Erie, PA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a very thorough process. It took a little longer than I had anticipated for the background check to come back but I understand they want to make sure the employee is going to be a good fit for their company, I can appreciate that. Otherwise overall I feel like it was a seamless process and I am very satisfied with the professionalism and kindness I have been shown by everyone I have came in contact with from the  company up to now!
Interview Questions:
Where do I see myself in 5 years?
What brings me back to acute care vs long term care?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Jefferson Hills, PA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough and professional. They were friendly too and I didn’t feel as nervous as I thought I would be for this interview. Gave an accurate description of the position and the duties.
Interview Questions: Asked about my experience as well as how I would handle a range of different scenarios.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: GoodComfortable environment appropriate temperature made to feel comfortable and welcome interviewer maintained iContact and relaxed position which helped me feel at ease myself to answer questions accurately.  Was not a very long process seems like an adequate amount of time which I appreciated
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situations

title: Patient Safety Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was more of a conversation based off of my answers to questions. Very laid back. A lot of talk about "what would you do" in certain situations and "tell me about a time where..."
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you were working in a group setting that didn't go so well.

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: after your application , a recruiter contacts you and follows up with a phone interview and asks personality/situational questions and then from there decides if they will continue onto in-person interviews and what hospitals are best suited for you.
Interview Questions: Why AHN? Your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Online over zoom due to COVID. There were two employees interviewing me The interview questions were pretty basic analysis questions to see how you would react to situations. It was harder to see reactions since they had masks on.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to deal with a difficult patient and what you did.

title: Appointment Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and conversational. Pretty standard questions if you've been in another customer faxing position. Leadership has changed since I was hired so its possible things have changed. Overall it was a great experience and interviewers were friendly and professional.
Interview Questions: What would you to deescalate a difficult patient?

title: Rehabilitation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: The first was face to face with social distance, CDC guidelines and the second was a zoom meeting, both, 1 hour with open/closed ended questions with general meeting of staff and work area/methodology.
Interview Questions: What do you think about or how would you handle criticism from your supervisor?

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pitts, PA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very nice staff and 2 step interview process. First step is a call from the coordinator and the next one is a combination of leaders from various institutions.  Asks you about your interests and goals as a student and future new graduate. They do everything they can to make the experience positive.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Allegheny Health Network?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. very relaxed. Took about 15 minutes. 1. Tell me about yourself. 2. Give an example of a time you went above and beyond for a patient. 3. What kind of salary are you looking for? 4. How do you see yourself fitting into this position? Was told I would I would hear back from a hiring manager in 1-2 weeks.
Interview Questions: 1. Tell me about yourself. 2. Give an example of a time you went above and beyond for a patient. 3. What kind of salary are you looking for? 4. How do you see yourself fitting into this position?

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Seven interviews for seven positions. All were in hospital cafeteria. Was told on every interview that they knew me, knew my excellent work ethic, knew that I totally understood the naming convention and habits of the system, and they loved my trouble shooting. And that I was only there because they have to write something down and that I was a "shoe-in". Then I find someone was already picked before the interviews even started.
Interview Questions: Read above in the description.

title: Ob/Gyn Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: The staff was friendly.  The scheduling process was convenient.  It was well planned and all questions were answered. The day was full of the necessary aspects without wasting the candidates time.
Interview Questions: Why choice obstetrics and gynecology?

title: Manager of Project Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Quick, easy, clear expectations, consisted of a phone interview and 2 in person interviews. Clear and detailed description of role and responsibilities. Overall a great experience. Mostly behavioral questions as well as questions that tied directly to the responsibility of the role.
Interview Questions: Why should we choose you for this role?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted within a week. Several positions were offered to me. They explained each and let me choose what I was most interested in. Phone screening through human resources, phone interview, then in-person interview. Tour of unit. Management recommended shadowing with a nurse on the unit before accepting.
Interview Questions: Normal questions... experience related, personality questions

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The hiring an interview process were both simple. They were very personable, and created a great atmosphere. The questions were straightforward, and they did not ask questions that could not be answered.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: RN BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Monroeville, PA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I initially had a phone interview with HR after applying, then  I was interviewed by the manager and assistant manager of my unit. Another nurse working on my unit joined us part way through the interview and asked a few questions. After the interview, I toured the unit and was free to leave.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation with a difficult patient and how you handled it.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very positive, both HR and the hiring manager offered an excellent view of responsibilities and why I was qualified.  In addition they kept me informed of the hiring status.
Interview Questions: Why was I hesitating on accepting the position.

title: Executive Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the recruiter, interview with the practice supervisor, and one with doctor. They asked me questions on my background, gave me job description, and background on the clinic.
Interview Questions: Rate your computer skills

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied as a new grad for a staff nurse position in one of the specialty units at West Penn Hospital.  Phone interview first with a member of HR team.  Asked general questions about background, strengths, weaknesses, experience, why Allegheny Health, why I was interested in working in the unit to which I applied....very standard interview questions

After that, I was asked to come for an in person interview with the unit director.  i was asked to wear scrubs so that I could shadow in the unit for a few hours.  

I got a call the day after my in person interview offering me the job.  From application to accepting the position was 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work for Allegheny Health Network

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: 2-3 one on one interviews. Generally behavior-based type questions. Nothing too dramatic, just your run of the mill type interview questions. Most questions focused on prior experience and how it would relate to my ability to do the job. There did not seem to be a set of standardized questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deal with ambiguity in the workplace and what did you do to bring clarity.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then face to face and hired. Very easy they were ready to hire me on the spot. Referral gets you in quick. They actually took a bunch of us nurses out to dinner to make us accept their offer.
Interview Questions: What’s your biggest weakness you have?

title: Clinical Informatics Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: It was fine relaxed and very reasonable. In person and phone interviews were conducted. I am just trying to pad the word requirement now yes there apparently need to be at least 30 words which is a lot I think
Interview Questions: Standard Interview Questions it was nothing out of the ordinary, you could get through the interview if you knew what you were talking about .

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with a Nursing Recruiter who had called me. We talked for about 20-30 minutes on the phone then she scheduled an interview for me with the department manager.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to deal with a difficult patient and how you handled it.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: was easy not difficult, just standard/ common question and not really technical question, and asked how many year i have the experience and also they asked if i can work night shift as well
Interview Questions: are you  a team player and working by yourself and in team

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (New York, NY) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Simple phone interview;  I was told they would choose their candidate the beginning of the following week.  When I heard nothing by the end of that week, I assumed they'd chosen someone else.  I got a call, however from my recruiter, saying they've now (end of the day on a Friday) offered me the position, but I would need to be there at the very beginning of the following week.  
I was not even afforded 15 minutes to decide and give my response to my recruiter before he called me, telling me the hiring manager rescinded my offer.  Yet, they allowed their first choice candidate 3 days to decide.  

Unacceptable.
Interview Questions: Are you certified?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward, they just try and get a feel for if its a good fit. Intern positions are pretty relaxed and low-stakes from their perspective, so as long as you don't make a fool of yourself, you should be fine.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go into healthcare

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The Interview process was extremely professional. It was an not intimidating and I felt relaxed.  There are many parts f AHN and, every department for this position might be different. Not much education is required for this position . The overall experience for the interview was pleasant. I was not offered the position or called back to further the process, as my education level exceeds on what is needed for the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it was a good interview experience. The recruiter is so nice and the questions are not hard, just general nursing interview questions that you can search on the internet/youtube/here. Firstly, the recruiter described the overall process of this interview  and it went for general questions such as confirmation of your education degree or your prior work experience/your license status. Then, it got right to the point.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself/Tell me a time you went beyond your patient/Why do you choose AHN/Tell me about your prior work experience/Where do you see yourself in 5 years/Describe a difficult situation with patient and how you handled it/Tell me a difficult situation or conflict with colleague and what't the outcome

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of a prescreen via phone with a recruiter then an in person interview with the hiring manager. Had to take a written test before proceeding with the interview.
Interview Questions: What does attendance mean to you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I am a newly graduated RN and passed my boards a few months ago. I applied online and heard back within a week to setup a phone interview with HR. The phone interview was about a week later and was roughly 20 minutes with basic interview questions (why did you want to be a nurse, tell me a time when you had to deal with conflict, etc). I then set up a second interview which was based off of when I was available (set it up the next week). I ended up meeting with two unit managers because I was interested in two different units. I was asked to wear scrubs to the in person interview so that I could shadow the unit after the interview. They were very nice and made me feel welcomed and not nervous. They only asked a handful of interview questions. I had been on a few interviews prior to this one and was offered a position at a different location. I waited a few days to hear back from AHN before I decided to email HR. I let them know that while AHN would be my first choice, I was offered a position at a different location and wanted to be assured that an offer was on the line before denying the other offer and to see if there was anything they could do to speed up the process. They got back to me within an hour with an offer. Between the start of the interview and my start date it takes about a month (due to offer letter, sign on, background check, drug/alcohol test, and physical). Overall I would say that I had an awesome and speedy experience with AHN.
Interview Questions: Why AHN?

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly short and straight to the point.  I interviewed with the Operations managers and the scheduler during the interview.  After the interview I was given a tour of the pharmacy and that was it.
Interview Questions: How long have you been a technician and what experiences have you had in that time?

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: call/email from HR, scheduled interview, went to interview, I pretty much knew I got the job before I left. I got a call telling me I was getting an offer letter.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you were a leader and what you had to do?

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions:
Initially I received an email to schedule a phone interview. 
At the end of the phone interview the recruiter told me there will be a second round through skype and got my skype ID too. But they never got back to me after that. I sent them follow-up emails and there was no response.
Interview Questions: General questions

title: Simulation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was in-person with department manager and managing director of the simulation center. 30-40 minutes; included a review of job expectations and a tour of the center. The questions were focused on personality fit and background experience; they were interested in how a potential employee would fit with and add to the team.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you went above and beyond for a customer.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a corporate recruiter based on a previous position I had applied to at a different hospital in their system. She was calling to gauge interest in interviewing for the main hospital’s core and stat labs that had 2 full time positions open. I had a phone interview later that week that went through skills, education, professional goals and previous work history. She then sent her recommendation to the laboratory manager who contacted me and scheduled an interview. We met at the core lab down the street from the main hospital. The interview process lasted in total about 45 minutes where we discussed a lot of the same things as the phone interviewer had. The questions focused mainly on relationships with previous employers/coworkers, a gauge into personality compatibility, a history of how I had gotten to this point in my life and what motivates me in this line of work. The interview was half scripted and half conversational leading into a comfortable zone where it was just 2 professionals discussing common experiences. Afterward we toured the lab and said goodbye. I heard back from HR only 3-4 business days later with an offer. The process of job offer to start date was roughly about 4 weeks.
Interview Questions: There were many “Tell me about a time when...”  questions that gauged responses to stress, difficult coworkers, problem solving, likes and dislikes of previous positions and one focused on dealing with failure and it’s resolution.

title: Food Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: It took about thirty minutes in total and they asked me basic questions about my previous experience and how I usually handle challenging situations and how I interact with people both coworkers and patients
Interview Questions: What previous experience do you have

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted by Human Resources and had a phone interview. After I was set up for an in-person interview and tour of the unit. Overall is was a fairly easy interview and it was nice to have a small tour of the unit and be able to meet some of the staff
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation either with a patient, patient's family or co-worker and how you handled it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty typical for a nursing position. First I had HR interview then in person with the hiring manager. they asked a lot of the standard questions like tell me about a time you had a difficult patient and how you handled it
Interview Questions: Tell me about your greatest strengths

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with HR, then with hiring manager in person, then with Sr. Director of another department that works hand-in-hand, then with VP in person.  Pretty informal with manager, but VP was a tough one.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I spoke with a recruiter, who asked me which one particular patient experience inspired me to be a nurse. She then scheduled my in-person interviews with the directors of nursing units.

The director of the orthopedics nursing unit had me first ask him questions. Then he asked me why he should hire me. He asked me zero questions about my employment, although I was mid-career. From the beginning of the interview, his facial expressions and tone of voice conveyed hostility.

The director of another nursing unit, which later was reorganized on another floor, allowed me to ask questions. She acknowledged my work experience and skills. She invited me to shadow her nurses so I could evaluate the work environment and so her nurses could evaluate my personality and technical skills. She offered a job to me.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Associate Abstractor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very casual and they offered the job on site. They were more interested in personality rather than experience. The hiring manager said the wage was one thing and HR said it was another which was interesting. Overall positive interview
Interview Questions: Why I wanted the position and to become a part of AHN

title: Clinical Informatics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for job via a reference/  internal resource. I met with two managers and a director. It occurred over the phone. I had multiple interviews and so I don't think it followed the typical process and experience.
Interview Questions: What are your favorite hobbies?

title: Executive Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions:
Filled out application through their website, was contacted via email a few days later to set up a short phone interview which I set up for a few days after they contacted me. 
The phone interview was quite short....to be honest it was the first interview whatsoever at all I'd had in a long time so I know I stumbled over what I wanted to say......but I'll also admit it was really just basic screening questions. Seemed to be most interested in my salary requirement....which is the reason I received a rejection email within 3 days. Oh well....their loss!!! I needed the practice anyways!
Interview Questions: What are your salary requirements?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: More about personality traits than actual experience.  It was a panel interview with persons from the department ranging from would be peers to senior management.  Most of the inquiries was geared towards what type of fit I would be in the department.  The interview was about 1.5 hours and consisted of 2 different interviews.  The first was with possible peers and the manager and the second the senior director of the department.
Interview Questions: How can your experience improve the dynamic of the department you are applying for?

title: Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I got to the office, and the receptionist had me wait in an empty conference room while she went to find the person who was supposed to be interviewing me. Turns out she had called off and, apparently, forgot about my interview, because she had not arranged for someone else to interview me or tried to contact me to reschedule. The receptionist assured me that she'd find someone who could interview me, but when she finally did, that person seemed unenthusiastic, even annoyed that she had to interview me.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to show empathy.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was for the initial HR phone screening, I was offered to do a face to face with the nurse manager on the unit. The phone interview took about 20 mins
Interview Questions: Why Allegheny Health Network?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then in person. Usual questions. Not really that difficult. Pleasant experience. The phone interview was about thirty minutes but the in person interview was longer. There were not any tricky questions.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?What are your weaknesses. Why do you want to work here.

title: Clinical Informatics Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty lengthy. Involved a single interview with the manager first, then a panel interview with some of the other clinical informatics nurses. Overall, it was a pretty straightforward interview with no real surprises.
Interview Questions: Q: Discuss a time where you have to work collaboratively to overcome a challenging situation?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the recruiter by email, asking to schedule a phone screen which we did. The recruiter was friendly and helpful. We set up an interview time at the end of the screen call. I received a confirmation email, then a more detailed email with instructions/directions. I was met by the two hiring managers and spend about an hour and half discussing the position and my qualifications. I found them both to be well-spoken and engaged, and they described what was needed in detail. A very good experience.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had a conflict with a co-worker or boss, and how you dealt with it.

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process moved quickly and they were very responsive throughout. Never felt like I was in the dark at any moment and was always able to contact someone at AHN if I had any questions or issues.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: MCS Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with the Director and then another Coordinator. They were lovely. Very inofrmative. Answered most of my questions before I had to ask them. The hospital is impressive. Still need to meet with another coordinator and surgeons.
Interview Questions: Why was I interested in the position

title: Patient Hostess Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process of the interview involved questions took about five to ten mins, and they also show you what type of work you will be doing if you are hired. It is helpful because it gives you a feel to what you will be doing.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in food service?

title: Preservices Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process. one phone interview and one personal interview. Called with offer within one week. Had to do background check. Then needed a physical as well as drug screening. This process took about three weeks total.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you went above and beyond in your career

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Penn Pitt, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Short phone interview followed by an in person interview with PI. Overall an easy experience. Be sure to review previous work and research so that you can talk about the details with ease.
Interview Questions: Basic background knowledge of genetics and immunology

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: i met with multiple managers and they all explained how they could and would use me.  It was very comprehensive and it showed me what i was getting into, i liked that.  They also were very easy to talk to and made me feel very relaxed, it almost didnt feel like an interview, but more like a conversation
Interview Questions: what is your greatest weakness

title: IT Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The entire interview process was extremely pleasant and easy. It consisted of being contacted by HR after applying, doing a brief phone interview, setting up an in-person interview with a director and VP, then accepting the position.
Interview Questions: Tell us more about yourself and your background.

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Then they called for phone screen,  asked basic interview question. I didn't have meeting minutes experience they were required. all process took about 5 days after I applied online. They sent me email that i didn't get this offer right after phone screen. Interviewer was very nice.
Interview Questions: experience in secretary job

title: Registered Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a call from recruiter about 10 days later. He asked questions about background and experience and explained the position and scheduling. He did asks a few questions like "Tell me why you became a nurse?" And "Tell me about a difficult patient you've had?" He then set me up with an interview two days later. Met with nurse manager for interview and she gave me background about hospital and position. Then gave me a tour of the floor. She said that they would be in touch. Recruiter called the next day to see how interview went and offer the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you went above and beyond for a patient?

title: Business/IS Analyst - Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I was reached out to via phone rather randomly from a manager of an IT department roughly a week or so of applying for the position. He let me know that he received his resume, was looking to fill a position, and thought my resume was the perfect fit, which obviously made me pretty excited. I was on a long weekend vacation, so I could not discuss the position there, and we rescheduled for the next Monday to interview about the position. 

As a preface, the position I applied for within this department was an entry-level position, consisting of minimal to moderate knowledge of SQL, advanced knowledge of excel, and Microsoft Office. Any data modeling experience was a bonus. I exceeded all of these significantly. 

So I spoke with the manager of the department on that Monday, whom firstly was very distracted during the interview and largely seemed like a different person all together than previously. He evidently had a lot going on and forced the interview just to get it out of the way. The manager was speaking to people in the background while I was going through my experiences, and it was rather distracting because I didn't know if he was interrupting me to ask a question, or talking to someone in the background. But, at the time I just kept going with the process. The questions he asked towards the end of the interview about my technical background were absolutely absurd in comparison to some of the top consulting and IT firms I've interviewed with. For example, he was asking me (based on my resume experience) the exact updated model number of a program I used two years ago. Not something along the lines of what program or anything, but more so what version at that time was the most recently update of the program. Nothing about how I used the program, what I used it for, or what questions it helped solve for the project. 

I figured that was just a exploratory question, but he asked that about every one of my technical experiences. At this point I figured he just evidently did not care about the interview, and was trying to grill me. I enjoy hard questions because it provokes thought, but these were ridiculous. I tried describing my experiences with said programs, however was cut off each time by him to again describe what version numbers I used. I guess this could be useful in some scenarios, but these were his only questions about my resume. 

Finally he began asking if I had experience with programs that only a computer engineer or someone with a graduate degree in computer sciences would know. My resume evidently did not show these, as I applied to a position within the realm of my knowledge and skill set. 

He then asked "what if I told you weren't technical enough for the position?", at which point I was pretty frustrated with a general waste of time. I then re-read the preferred requirements of the position from the job posting (I had pulled it up in front of me at this point) to him, and retorted with a similar question, asking him "why you would hire a corporate real estate developer to build a shed in your back yard?"(putting emphasis on the overkill for the requirements he listed in correspondence  for the position). I then explained why my experiences and technical skills were far enough along to thrive in this position. 

I assumed at this point I was eliminated from the position because I could not meet his outlandish technical experience for a pretty much entry level analyst role, consisting of using excel to gather data and write reports. This was overall the worst interviewing experience I have had, not because I couldn't answer the questions, but because the interviewer was overall just horrible. He was frustrated, seemed disgusted to have to interview someone, and worst of all was sidetracked. If this is a reflection of the company, I can't say for sure. However, this department did not seem to have its priorities straight at the time of the interview, considering the fact that he was the manager of the department and was so scatter brained. I've had hard interviews before that I was at least able to take positives away and appreciate my time for the interview, helping me develop more. This...this was just frankly a huge waste of time.
Interview Questions: Nothing that was of help to future interviewers...what version numbers my programs were, a lot of detail oriented things that seemed largely irrelevant.

title: Abstractor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple and quick. There's an initial pre-screening phone interview then you get called back within a day or two to schedule a face to face interview. The face to face, at least for me, was the job offer and going over the basic information for the position.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Senior Business Intelligence Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: lengthy and tiered. Met with other senior developers, resources managers and project managers and director last. In all about 3 hours or so. No real consistency from those interviewing in questions or conversation.
Interview Questions: Some technical aspects, some overall conceptual. IE what is an index, when would you use it

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pitts, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with three people - all within different levels of the organization. Meeting with HR, hiring director and then the vice president of that division. The job I applied for was not the one I eventually being hired for
Interview Questions: What can I make the organization better?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very smooth and organized. Anticipated steps in the process were pretty generic as well as the  actions taken. Standard questions by a human resources clerk, followed by a follow up review with the department manager.
Interview Questions: Your style of employee discipline

title: Administrative Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: two different interviews.  First one was just a one on one very casual with the hiring director.  second interview was with 2 VP and 2 Directors.  Very unique experience got you to think outside of the box and really make your mind aggressively think.
Interview Questions: They flipped a question I asked them on me.  I had to answer my own question.

title: Hospice Intake Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Erie, PA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a personable experience. I met with the Director and the Administrator. Very friendly and they were honest about what the job in details. It was short and straight to the point.
Interview Questions: Why did you decide to apply for this position?

title: Patient Hostess Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: she left out ALOT of the job details and made it seem ok but once I started it was a neverything *20 of what your job duties intelled. so its a huge blow on your 1st day
Interview Questions: availabilty

title: Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with two managers and was eventually selected to work for one who had more positions open at the hospitals she was working with.  They called back very quickly and were interested in my start date being as early as possible.
Interview Questions: I cannot remember many of the quesions that were asked due to the interview being quite a while ago.

title: Call Center Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an initial interview shortly after applying online.  The interview with the Customer Service Manager went well.  I wanted to wait until my job at my current employer ended with the call center closure.  The Manager was receptive to this request.  I was advised by the HR recruiter that I was top on their list for consideration.  I contacted the HR manager when the call center I was working in closed.  I was advised that I was to meet with two recently hired supervisors to discuss changes that were made in the AHN call center since I had interviewed.  I clarified with the HR recruiter that this was a meeting, and not a second interview.  I was assured it was a meeting to share information.  When I met with the two supervisors who would have been my peers, this meeting turned out to be an additional interview.  After the interview, I reached out to the HR recruiter and advised her that I thought that the "meeting" went well.  She advised me that she should have results by the following week and would get back to me then.  That was the last correspondence that I've received from anyone associated with AHN.  I reached out to the recruited several times trying to get some sort of update, but was ignored each time.  If I was not going to be offered the position that would be fine, just let me know.  Very unprofessional conduct.
Interview Questions: Everyone breaks a rule every now and then.  Give me an example of a time you broke a rule and what happened.

title: Customer Service Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was brought on for an interview about two or three weeks later. The people were very nice and the process was simple. However, it did take about a month to get any feedback.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with change?

title: Preservices Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: You will be contacted by a hiring representative from Human Resources in which they will schedule a phone interview-approx 1 hour. From there, they forward the information to the hiring supervisor for review. Who will then contact you for an in person interview -approx 1 hour. They will forward the information back to the hiring rep who will then contact you with an offer. If you choose to accept they schedule you for orientation and then mandatory drug testing and physical evaluation.
Interview Questions: Name multiple scenarios where you went out of your way to help a patient?

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: quick and easy, process was smooth without any glitches or hick-ups.  quick response to application and interviews set up just as quickly.  time given was more than sufficient
Interview Questions: in line with the position

title: IT Sourcing & Procurement Contracts Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Fantastic Management!  I am not even upset that I was rejected because of how amazing it feels to be excited about a potential employer.  This is the organization for me.  There were three different phone interviews that lasted three months because of the holidays.  After three months, I was invited to meet two of the Procurement Directors who were very nice to meet.  They said I passed so they then welcomed me past the locked doors and I got to meet their supervisor (VP Operations), who I could tell immediately was an awesome person to work for.  He ended up being prior military, which is similar to me.  I passed his test and had someone from the Talent Acquisition Office set up a meeting to meet the executives of the proposed program office assignment for the position.  For some reason the recruiter's meeting invite was for 10:00 AM when the interview was really for 1:00 PM so I got to show up twice and look like an idiot.  Anyway, I interviewed with two different CIOs at the same time and they were pretty cool as well.  Unfortunately, I got a call from the VP Operations who delivered the bad news.  He told me they were considering me for the same type of position with a different department but I have not heard anything yet.  Either way, I really liked everyone and plan on applying to future openings.  This role was not a management role and I feel that it could have possibly sent me in the wrong direction had I been offered the position.  I was blown away by how comfortable I was at times like I already fit in.  There were times that I had to remind myself not to get too relaxed.  The competitor(s) are in trouble because this is an organization stacked with top talent.  I am confident that I will be chosen for one of the next one or two openings that are posted.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions.  The most difficult experience for me was the nervousness I had because of how bad I wanted the job.  I was not used to liking a company as much as I did Highmark.  Their procurement team is exceptional and highly recommend applying because it was refreshing, at least for me, to be able to be myself and feel like I could go to work on a daily basis feeling like everyone is on the same team with the same mission and let us all have fun together accomplishing our mission.  I know that sounds corny but I really take my work seriously and enjoy doing it, except when I am in a situation like I currently am where I feel like management is taking advantage of my drive and dedication.

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Erie, PA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: You're interviewed by a group of peers you will be working with along with a manager who fire questions at you round table style.  There were two separate interviews for me, so if you are not from the area, you may be traveling twice on your own to complete the process.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a challenging situation at your last job and how you handled it.

title: Patient Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: A few phone calls and a final in person interview with my direct supervisor. The interview process was complicated because I didn't live in the Pittsburgh area at the time.
Interview Questions: Basic getting to know you types of questions. There were little specifics about the actual position because it was a new role.

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a face to face with department head. Told me of daily tasks and talked about my background. Gave a tour of the building I'd be working in. Second interview was 2 hours. First hour was with a panel of workers that did the job I'd applied for. Asked a few technical questions.
Interview Questions: If given a 169.254 IP Address, what is that telling you

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview process consisted of one phone screen with the HR recruiter and one in person interview with the hiring manager.  The entire process seemed very rushed.  (This should have been a red flag).  I did not met anyone else in person prior to being hired.  There was not much discussion of the real duties of the position.
Interview Questions: The interviewers did not seem to have a clear idea of what the ideal candidate for this position would be.  As a result, many questions seemed to be irrelevant.

title: Senior Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions:
About three and a half months after I applied for the postion, I was contacted by a Practice Manager to interview. There was no phone screening or any interaction with HR. The Practice Manager was pleasant, but didn't actually ask me any questions about my skills or experience during the interview. She mostly talked about the position and asked if I was interested. 

I came back for second interview and was interviewed by pretty much everyone that worked in the office. Everyone was pleasant but the questions were repetitive.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an employee that is taking too much personal time off?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: After applying online at AGH I was contacted to conduct a face to face interview with the unit director.  She was professional and very nice.  We talked for about an hour about the job description and the unit.  She went through a series of questions about nursing and nursing related situations.  After that we toured the unit, met some staff and some physicians. In the end it took them about a week to get back to me and they offered me the job.
Interview Questions: Describe your most unsafe nursing situation and how did you respond

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Allegheny Health Network (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: Was thorough and included upper management and would be peer group.
Interview Questions: What do you think most determines a person's success?
